Name: Mercury
Orbit: Takes 88 Earth days to complete one orbit around the sun.
Size: Smallest planet in the solar system, with a diameter of about 4,880 km.
Appearance: Has a rocky, cratered surface similar to the Moon.
Rotation: Rotates slowly on its axis, taking about 59 Earth days.
SpecialFact: Mercury has extreme temperature fluctuations, ranging from -173°C at night to 427°C during the day.

Name: Venus
Orbit: Takes about 225 Earth days to orbit the sun.
Size: Similar in size to Earth with a diameter of about 12,104 km.
Appearance: Thick atmosphere with clouds of sulfuric acid, appearing bright and yellowish.
Rotation: Rotates very slowly and in the opposite direction to most planets.
SpecialFact: Venus has a runaway greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.

Name: Earth
Orbit: Takes about 365.25 days to orbit the sun.
Appearance: Blue planet with abundant water and life.
Rotation: Rotates on its axis once approximately every 24 hours.
SpecialFact: Earth is the only planet known to support life, with diverse ecosystems and climates.

Name: Mars
Orbit: Takes about 687 Earth days to complete one orbit.
Appearance: Known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface.
Moon: Two small moons: Phobos and Deimos.
Rotation: Rotates on its axis approximately every 24.6 hours.
SpecialFact: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons, which stands about 22 km high.

Name: Jupiter
Orbit: Takes about 11.9 Earth years to orbit the sun.
Size: Largest planet in the solar system, with a diameter of about 139,820 km.
Appearance: Known for its Great Red Spot and colorful bands of clouds.
Moon: Has at least 79 moons, including the four largest: Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto.
SpecialFact: Jupiter has a strong magnetic field and is surrounded by a massive radiation belt.

Name: Saturn
Orbit: Takes about 29.5 Earth years to complete one orbit.
Appearance: Famous for its prominent ring system.
Moon: Has at least 83 moons, including Titan, the second-largest moon in the solar system.
Rotation: Rotates quickly, causing an oblate spheroid shape.
SpecialFact: Saturn's rings are made primarily of ice particles, with sizes ranging from tiny grains to large chunks.

Name: Uranus
Orbit: Takes about 84 Earth years to orbit the sun.
Appearance: Pale blue color due to methane in the atmosphere.
Moon: Has at least 27 moons, including Titania and Oberon.
Rotation: Rotates on its side, with an axial tilt of about 98 degrees.
SpecialFact: Uranus is the only planet that rotates on its side, leading to extreme seasonal changes.

Name: Neptune
Orbit: Takes about 165 Earth years to complete one orbit.
Appearance: Deep blue color, with active weather patterns.
Moon: Has at least 14 moons, including Triton.
SpecialFact: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system, reaching speeds of over 2,100 km/h.
